summary:
• Fungus kills frogs.
• Scientists suggest homemade saunas may help save them.
• Fungus causes frog deaths, with saunas potentially offering solution.

• Belarus has granted amnesty to five political prisoners
• This is a rare occurrence in the country
• The move suggests possible improvements in human rights conditions

• Brazil blocks Meta from using social media posts to train AI.
• This move is part of an ongoing effort to regulate tech giants in Brazil.
• The ban aims to protect users' privacy rights and prevent misuse of personal data.

• French PM says only far-right parties can form a majority in upcoming elections.
• Pétanque event in Marseille hides deep-seated political divisions before Sunday's vote.
• Deep-seated political divisions exist in Marseille ahead of Sunday's election.

• The election of Iran's new president will take place soon.
• The role of the Iranian President includes managing the country's government.
• A leader with a strong background in politics or public service is likely to be chosen as the next President.

• Israeli military targets Hezbollah leader in Lebanon.
• Hezbollah commander killed in Israeli airstrike.
• Conflict escalates between Israel and Hezbollah.

• Powerful Hurricane Beryl approaches Jamaica
• Hurricane Beryl moves closer to Jamaica
• Hurricane Beryl passes near Jamaica

• Cup Noodles introduces s'more-flavored ramen
• The new flavor combines traditional Japanese ramen with American campfire treats 
• S'more-flavored ramen is available in stores now

• Public outcry prompts pay rise freeze for Kenyan Members of Parliament.
• Freeze is implemented to address public discontent over perceived high salaries.
• Decision aims to restore trust in government's commitment to transparency and accountability.

• The US is funding deportations from Panama
• This is part of an effort to crack down on migrants in Panama
• The goal is to reduce the number of people entering or staying in Panama illegally

• Over 30 passengers injured in severe turbulence
• Diverted flight from Europe to Brazil
• No fatalities reported

• Worst hurricane ever described by Union Island resident
• Almost entire island left homeless after Hurricane Beryl

• South African zoos are using in vitro fertilization (IVF) to breed endangered white rhino species.
• The goal is to increase their population and reduce poaching threats.
• This method allows conservationists to carefully select breeding partners for optimal genetic diversity.

• The world's oldest cave art has been discovered in Spain, featuring depictions of humans and pigs.
• This 51,000-year-old painting is believed to be one of the earliest scenes ever depicted using art.
• The discovery provides valuable insights into prehistoric human culture and artistic expression.

• Syrian forces clashed with Turkish troops.
• The conflict began as a response to anti-migrant riots in Turkey.
• The incident highlights rising tensions between the two nations.

• Ukraine accuses Russia of using brutal tactics in its efforts to seize territory.
• Public support for Hamas is waning due to the ongoing conflict in Gaza.
• In Kyiv, hidden and missing monuments symbolize resistance against war.

• The UK's general election is underway amid controversy surrounding the campaign trail.
• Jewish voters who previously deserted the Labour party due to anti-Semitism are returning in large numbers.
• Meanwhile, the ruling Conservative party faces an existential threat as they struggle to maintain their grip on power.

• Biden faces increasing pressure to withdraw from his presidential bid.
• Blazing wildfires have led to evacuations in California.
• The Supreme Court has granted Trump temporary immunity in several cases.
